feature1.explanation: Both texts exhibit the use of unconventional punctuation marks such as emojis, quotation marks, and special characters.

feature2.explanation: There are differences in word choice and formality levels between the two texts. The first text uses more formal language compared to the informal and expressive language of the second text.

feature3.explanation: The first text contains a longer and more complex sentence structure compared to the shorter and more fragmented sentences in the second text.

feature4.explanation: The tone and mood of the two texts differ significantly. The first text expresses frustration and criticism, while the second text conveys excitement and relief.

feature5.explanation: There are no spelling or typographical errors in either text.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, and tone, the texts are unlikely to have been written by the same author despite some commonalities in punctuation style.
